hackathon-description-text: The California Wildfires of 2017 was the most destructive wildfire season in history. Even though these fires have been contained, a new wildfire season is heading our way. Relief efforts for wildfire emergencies are not perfect and opportunities for improvement are abundant. FireCode Hack aims to bring together innovative individuals to solve these problems through technology.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Senior Manager, Global Impact at Workday

hackathon-rules:
• Teams consists of 5-7 people
• You must follow the code of conduct: https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: - Madonna Inn Champagne Cake - Workday donation vouchers (valued between $20-$100) towards any cause for every team member

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How well does it work? How technically complex is the solution?
Is the solution you’ve designed creative and intuitive?
Is your solution solving one of the problems?
Was your presentation clear and convincing?
Up to 5 extra points will be rewarded for teams who utilize Workday Cloud Platform and/or PulsePoint API’s
